title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/geoops.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version geoops ropensci/geoops) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/geoops.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Please write test(s) changes affect code just docs Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/geoops

title: GeoJSON Topology Calculations and Operations
text: geoops spatial operations GeoJSON. geoops inspired JS library turf (http://turfjs.org/). ’s tagline Advanced geospatial analysis browsers node. Turf works GeoJSON, geoops. don’t know JS well, ’s easy enough understand language, ’ve porting Turf C++ wrapped R. C++ can fast performance. ’ve also wrapped Turf JS library package lawn (https://github.com/ropensci/lawn), able get better performance C++. geoops ways go include methods Turf , ’ll get eventually. data expected WGS-84. use library Niels Lohmann (https://github.com/nlohmann/json) working JSON C++. See also: geojson: https://github.com/ropensci/geojson Package API:
code: #>  - geo_bearing #>  - geo_midpoint #>  - geo_bbox_polygon #>  - geo_pointgrid #>  - geo_area #>  - geo_get_coords #>  - version #>  - geo_nearest #>  - geo_along #>  - geo_distance #>  - geo_destination #>  - geo_trianglegrid #>  - geo_planepoint #>  - geo_line_distance

title: GeoJSON Topology Calculations and Operations
text: FIXME!!! remove rgeos stuff pkg gone

title: GeoJSON Topology Calculations and Operations
code: pt1 <- '{"type":"Feature","properties":{"marker-color":"#f00"},"geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[-75.343,39.984]}}' pt2 <- '{"type":"Feature","properties":{"marker-color":"#0f0"},"geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[-75.534,39.123]}}' library(rgeos) rgeospt1 <- rgeos::readWKT("POINT(0.5 0.5)") rgeospt2 <- rgeos::readWKT("POINT(2 2)") microbenchmark::microbenchmark(   rgeos = rgeos::gDistance(rgeospt1, rgeospt2),   geoops = geoops::geo_distance(pt1, pt2, units = "miles"),   times = 10000L )

title: GeoJSON Topology Calculations and Operations
code: point1 <- '{"type":["Feature"],"properties":{"marker-color":["#0f0"]},"geometry":{"type":["Point"],"coordinates":[28.9658,41.0101]}}' point2 <- '{"type":["FeatureCollection"],"features":[{"type":"Feature","properties":{},"geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[28.9739,41.0111]}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{},"geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[28.9485,41.0242]}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{},"geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[28.9387,41.0133]}}]}' points <- '{"type":"FeatureCollection","features":[{"type":"Feature","properties":{},"geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[28.9739,41.0111]}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{},"geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[28.9485,41.0242]}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{},"geometry":{"type":"Point","coordinates":[28.9387,41.0133]}}]}' g1 <- readWKT("MULTILINESTRING((34 54, 60 34), (0 10, 50 10, 100 50))") g2 <- readWKT("POINT(100 30)") microbenchmark::microbenchmark(   rgeos = rgeos::gNearestPoints(g1, g2),   geoops = geoops::geo_nearest(point1, points),   times = 10000L )

title: GeoJSON Topology Calculations and Operations
text: Get GeoJSON data, FeatureCollection Polygons Break polygon separate JSON string Using geo_area, calculate area polygon Visualize area polygons histogram Visualize polygons, Just one
code: file <- system.file("examples/zillow_or.geojson", package = "geoops") x <- paste0(readLines(file), collapse = "") library("jqr") polys <- unclass(jq(x, ".features[]")) areas <- vapply(polys, geo_area, 1, USE.NAMES = FALSE) hist(areas, main = "") library(leaflet) leaflet() %>%   addProviderTiles(provider = "OpenStreetMap.Mapnik") %>%   addGeoJSON(geojson = x) %>%   setView(lng = -123, lat = 45, zoom = 7) leaflet() %>%   addProviderTiles(provider = "OpenStreetMap.Mapnik") %>%   addGeoJSON(geojson = polys[1]) %>%   setView(lng = -122.7, lat = 45.48, zoom = 13)

title: Feature — Feature
text: GeoJSON object type "Feature" feature object: feature object must member name "geometry". value geometry member geometry object defined JSON null value. feature object must member name "properties". value properties member object (JSON object JSON null value). feature commonly used identifier, identifier included member feature object name "id".

title: FeatureCollection — FeatureCollection
text: GeoJSON object type "FeatureCollection" feature collection object. object type "FeatureCollection" must member name "features". value corresponding "features" array. element array feature object defined .

title: GeometryCollection — GeometryCollection
text: element geometries array GeometryCollection one geometry objects described .

title: LineString — LineString
text: type "LineString", "coordinates" member must array two positions. LinearRing closed LineString 4 positions. first last positions equivalent (represent equivalent points). Though LinearRing explicitly represented GeoJSON geometry type, referred Polygon geometry type definition.

title: MultiLineString — MultiLineString
text: type "MultiLineString", "coordinates" member must array LineString coordinate arrays.

title: GeoJSON MultiPoint — MultiPoint
text: type "MultiPoint", "coordinates" member must array positions.

title: MultiPolygon — MultiPolygon
text: type "MultiPolygon", "coordinates" member must array Polygon coordinate arrays.

title: GeoJSON Point — Point
text: type "Point", "coordinates" member must single position.

title: Polygon — Polygon
text: type "Polygon", "coordinates" member must array LinearRing coordinate arrays. Polygons multiple rings, first must exterior ring others must interior rings holes.

title: Calculate distance between two GeoJSON points — geo_distance
text: distance, single numeric value, units given units parameter

title: Calculate distance between two GeoJSON points — geo_distance
code: point1 <- '{   "type": "Feature",   "properties": {     "marker-color": "#f00"    },    "geometry": {       "type": "Point",       "coordinates": [-75.343, 39.984]    } }'  point2 <- '{   "type": "Feature",   "properties": {      "marker-color": "#0f0"    },    "geometry": {       "type": "Point",       "coordinates": [-75.534, 39.123]     } }'  geo_distance(point1, point2) #> [1] 97.15958 geo_distance(point1, point2, units = "miles") #> [1] 60.37218 geo_distance(point1, point2, units = "degrees") #> [1] 0.8735029 geo_distance(point1, point2, units = "radians") #> [1] 0.0152455  pt1 <- '{   "type": "Feature",   "geometry": {     "type": "Point",     "coordinates": [        0.5,        0.5      ]    } }'  pt2 <- '{   "type": "Feature",   "geometry": {     "type": "Point",     "coordinates": [2, 2]    } }'  geo_distance(pt1, pt2, units = "miles") #> [1] 146.5956

what: Description of GeoJSON data types — geojson-types
title: Description of GeoJSON data types — geojson-types
text: Description GeoJSON data types

title: Description of GeoJSON data types — geojson-types
text: GeoJSON always consists single object. object (referred GeoJSON object ) represents geometry, feature, collection features. GeoJSON object may number members (name/value pairs). GeoJSON object must member name "type". member's value string determines type GeoJSON object. value type member must one : "Point", "MultiPoint", "LineString", "MultiLineString", "Polygon", "MultiPolygon", "GeometryCollection", "Feature", "FeatureCollection". case type member values must shown . GeoJSON object may optional "crs" member, value must coordinate reference system object (see 3. Coordinate Reference System Objects). GeoJSON object may "bbox" member, value must bounding box array (see 4. Bounding Boxes).

what: geoops: 'GeoJSON' Topology Calculations and Operations — geoops-package
title: geoops: 'GeoJSON' Topology Calculations and Operations — geoops-package
text: Tools calculations manipulations 'GeoJSON', 'geospatial' data interchange format (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946). 'GeoJSON' also valid 'JSON'.

title: geoops: 'GeoJSON' Topology Calculations and Operations — geoops-package
text: Maintainer: Scott Chamberlain myrmecocystus+r@gmail.com contributors: Niels Lohmann [copyright holder]

title: geoops: 'GeoJSON' Topology Calculations and Operations — geoops-package
code: library("geoops")  # Calculate distance between two GeoJSON points pt1 <- '{   "type": "Feature",   "properties": {     "marker-color": "#f00"    },    "geometry": {       "type": "Point",       "coordinates": [-75.343, 39.984]    } }'  pt2 <- '{   "type": "Feature",   "properties": {      "marker-color": "#0f0"    },    "geometry": {       "type": "Point",       "coordinates": [-75.534, 39.123]     } }' geo_distance(pt1, pt2) #> [1] 97.15958
